page.description: Internal use only. The SQL::Query::Join object fully describes the joining of a parent table to a referenced table. Key properties include .JoinType and (if an outer join) the .OuterJoinType.

property.name: ColumnReferences
property.description: Read Only. An array of all column references in the query (including nested occurrences). Behaves the same way as .SelectTableReferences.

property.name: ErrorColumn
property.description: Read Only. The column number of the last error reported by the parser.

property.name: ErrorText
property.description: Read Only. The text of the last parser error reported.

property.name: FunctionReferences
property.description: Read Only. An array of all function calls. Behaves the same way as .SelectTableReferences.

property.name: ObjectDefinitions
property.description: Read Only. For internal debugging. Returns a string description of the mapping between the ANTLR grammar and the Xbasic objects.

property.name: On
property.description: Read Write. The inclusion criteria for the join.

property.name: ParseTree
property.description: Read Only. For internal debugging. A string description of the underlying parse tree.

property.name: SQLStatement
property.description: Read Write. A variable that can be assigned a syntax string without parsing it. If no value is passed to the Parse() method, this value is used.

property.name: Table
property.description: Read Write. The table to be joined. Note: This SelectTableReference may include nested joins.

property.name: SelectTableReferences
property.description: Read Only. An array of all table references in the query (including those nested inside of sub-selects and joins). This array is created when the property is requested, but can become out of date. Use the Resynch() method on any variable holding this list when any changes are made.

property.name: XML
property.description: Read Write. Creates XML from the tree or recreates the tree from the XML.

methodref.name: Parse
methodref.description: Accepts an optional text string and parses it. If the parse is successful, the elements of the SQL statement will be available immediately as properties of the object.

methodref.name: Reset
methodref.description: Reinitializes the object as if it had just been declared.

section.note: Joins can nest. A SelectTableReference can contain a join and that join has a table reference which can also contain a join and so on.
